intro: Sarcosperma ovatifolium, commonly known as the oval-leaf sarcosperma, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many shrubs and small trees. The plant is characterized by its ovate leaves and clusters of small, white or pale yellow flowers. Its fruits are capsule-like structures that contain numerous tiny seeds. Sarcosperma ovatifolium is often found in moist, shaded habitats within forest understories.
